_header: Kneel down man let for no shame
_description: Be not ashamed to worship Jesus — two couplets

CamMagPep2125.Transcription:
Knele down man let for no shameTo wurshupe ihesu þi lordes
                    nameSythen angels knelyn & deuelis alsoWel auȝte þe man
                    to knele þerto
CamMagPep2125.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             A Register of Middle English Religious & Didactic Verse.
         2 vols. London: Oxford University Press for the Bibliographical
            Society: 1916-20: 1.219.
James,  Montague Rhodes. 
             Bibliotheca Pepysiana: A Descriptive Catalogue of the Library of Samuel
                Pepys. Pt. III: Medieval Manuscripts.
         London, 1923: 3.77.

BLAdd60577.Transcription:
knele adown man for schamewhan þu heryst Ihesu thy lordys
                    nameWeele þe semythe soo for to doSythe aungels and deuylys
                    bowythe þer to
BLAdd60577.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             “Introduction.” 
             The Winchester Anthology. A Facsimile of British Library Additional
                Manuscript 60577. With an account of the music by 
                    Iain
                    Fenlon. 
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1981.
